document.heading: Excepted Service Positions Designation Temporary Amendment Act of 1996

history.narrative: Law 11-156, the “Excepted Service Positions Designation Temporary Amendment Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-685. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 7, 1996, and June 4, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 17, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-284 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-156 became effective on September 20, 1996.
